rows.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
rows.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
rows.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

rows.arabic: أَتَىٰٓ أَمْرُ ٱللَّهِ فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُوهُ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ وَتَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: Allah’s edict is coming! So do not seek to hasten it. Immaculate is He and exalted above [having] any partners that they ascribe [to Him].
rows.transliteration: atā amrullāhi falā tasta`jilūh ۚ subḥānahu wata`ālā `ammā yushrikūn

rows.arabic: يُنَزِّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ بِٱلرُّوحِ مِنْ أَمْرِهِۦ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦٓ أَنْ أَنذِرُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱتَّقُونِ
rows.translation: He sends down the angels with the spirit of His command to whomever He wishes of His servants: ‘Warn [the people] that there is no god except Me; so be wary of Me.’
rows.transliteration: yunazzilul malā-ikata bir rūḥi min amrihi `alā man yashā-u min `ibādihi an andhirū annahu lā ilāha illā ana fattaqūn

rows.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ تَعَـٰلَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: He created the heavens and the earth with consummate wisdom. He is above having any partners that they ascribe [to Him].
rows.transliteration: khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa bil ḥaqq ۚ ta`ālā `ammā yushrikūn

rows.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: He created man from a drop of [seminal] fluid, and, behold, he is an open contender!
rows.transliteration: khalaqal-insāna min nuṭfatin fa-idhā huwa khaṣīmun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمَ خَلَقَهَا ۗ لَكُمْ فِيهَا دِفْءٌ وَمَنَـٰفِعُ وَمِنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: He created the cattle, in which there is warmth for you and [other] uses, and some of them you eat.
rows.transliteration: wal-an`āma khalaqahā ۗ lakum fīhā dif-un wa manāfi`u wa minhā ta-kulūn

rows.arabic: وَلَكُمْ فِيهَا جَمَالٌ حِينَ تُرِيحُونَ وَحِينَ تَسْرَحُونَ
rows.translation: There is in them a beauty for you when you bring them home for rest and when you drive them forth to pasture.
rows.transliteration: walakum fīhā jamālun ḥīna turīḥūna waḥīna tasraḥūn

rows.arabic: وَتَحْمِلُ أَثْقَالَكُمْ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٍ لَّمْ تَكُونُوا۟ بَـٰلِغِيهِ إِلَّا بِشِقِّ ٱلْأَنفُسِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: And they bear your burdens to towns, which you could not reach except by straining yourselves. Indeed your Lord is most kind and merciful.
rows.transliteration: wataḥmilu athqālakum ilā baladin lam takūnū bālighīhi illā bishiqqil-anfus ۚ inna rabbakum lara-ūfun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَٱلْخَيْلَ وَٱلْبِغَالَ وَٱلْحَمِيرَ لِتَرْكَبُوهَا وَزِينَةً ۚ وَيَخْلُقُ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: And horses, mules and asses, for you to ride them, and for pomp, and He creates what you do not know.
rows.transliteration: wal khayla wal bighāla wal ḥamīra litarkabūhā wazīnah ۚ wayakhluqu mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ قَصْدُ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَمِنْهَا جَآئِرٌ ۚ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَهَدَىٰكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: With Allah rests guidance to the straight path, and some of the paths are devious, and had He wished He would have guided you all.
rows.transliteration: wa`alallāhi qaṣdus sabīli wa minhā jā-ir ۚ walaw shā-a lahadākum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً ۖ لَّكُم مِّنْهُ شَرَابٌ وَمِنْهُ شَجَرٌ فِيهِ تُسِيمُونَ
rows.translation: It is He who sends down water from the sky: from it you get your drink and with it are [sustained] the plants wherein you pasture your herds.
rows.transliteration: huwal ladhī anzala minas samā-i mā-ā ۖ lakum minhu sharābun wa minhu shajarun fīhi tusīmūn

rows.arabic: يُنۢبِتُ لَكُم بِهِ ٱلزَّرْعَ وَٱلزَّيْتُونَ وَٱلنَّخِيلَ وَٱلْأَعْنَـٰبَ وَمِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: For you He makes the crops grow with it and olives, date palms, vines, and fruits of all kinds. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who reflect.
rows.transliteration: yunbitu lakum bihiz zar`a waz zaytūna wan nakhīla wal-a`nāba wa min kullith thamarāt ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy yatafakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ وَٱلنُّجُومُ مُسَخَّرَٰتٌۢ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: He disposed the night and the day for you, and the sun, the moon and the stars are disposed by His command. There are indeed signs in that for people who exercise their reason.
rows.transliteration: wasakhhara lakumul layla wan nahāra wash shamsa wal qamar ۖ wan nujūmu musakhharātun bi-amrih ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy ya`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا ذَرَأَ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَٰنُهُۥٓ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: And [He disposed for your benefit] whatever He has created for you in the earth of diverse hues—there is indeed a sign in that for a people who take admonition.
rows.transliteration: wa mā dhara-a lakum fil-arḍi mukhtalifan alwānuh ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy yadhhakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ ٱلْبَحْرَ لِتَأْكُلُوا۟ مِنْهُ لَحْمًا طَرِيًّا وَتَسْتَخْرِجُوا۟ مِنْهُ حِلْيَةً تَلْبَسُونَهَا وَتَرَى ٱلْفُلْكَ مَوَاخِرَ فِيهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: It is He who disposed the sea [for your benefit] that you may eat from it fresh meat, and obtain from it ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through it, that you may seek His bounty and that you may give thanks.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī sakhharal baḥra lita-kulū minhu laḥman ṭariyyan watastakhrijū minhu ḥilyatan talbasūnahā wataral fulka mawākhira fīhi walitabtaghū min faḍlihi wala`allakum tashkurūn

rows.arabic: وَأَلْقَىٰ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِكُمْ وَأَنْهَـٰرًا وَسُبُلًا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: He cast firm mountains in the earth lest it should shake with you, and [made] streams and ways, so that you may be guided
rows.transliteration: wa-alqā fil-arḍi rawāsiya an tamīda bikum wa-anhāran wasubulal la`allakum tahtadūn

rows.arabic: وَعَلَـٰمَـٰتٍ ۚ وَبِٱلنَّجْمِ هُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: —and the landmarks [as well]—and by the stars they are guided.
rows.transliteration: wa`alāmāt ۚ wabin najmi hum yahtadūn

rows.arabic: أَفَمَن يَخْلُقُ كَمَن لَّا يَخْلُقُ ۗ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Is He who creates like one who does not create? Will you not then take admonition?
rows.transliteration: afaman yakhluqu kaman lā yakhluq ۗ afalā tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَإِن تَعُدُّوا۟ نِعْمَةَ ٱللَّهِ لَا تُحْصُوهَآ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: If you enumerate Allah’s blessings, you will not be able to count them. Indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful,
rows.transliteration: wa in ta`uddū ni`matallāhi lā tuḥṣūhā ۗ innallāha laghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُسِرُّونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
rows.translation: and Allah knows whatever you hide and whatever you disclose.
rows.transliteration: wallāhu ya`lamu mā tusirrūna wa mā tu`linūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْـًٔا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ
rows.translation: Those whom they invoke besides Allah do not create anything and are themselves created.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yad`ūna min dūnillāhi lā yakhluqūna shay-an wahum yukhlaqūn

rows.arabic: أَمْوَٰتٌ غَيْرُ أَحْيَآءٍ ۖ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: They are dead and lifeless, and are not aware when they will be resurrected.
rows.transliteration: amwātun ghayru aḥyā-i ۖ wa mā yash`urūna ayyāna yub`athūn

rows.arabic: إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ قُلُوبُهُم مُّنكِرَةٌ وَهُم مُّسْتَكْبِرُونَ
rows.translation: Your God is the One God. Those who do not believe in the Hereafter, their hearts are in denial [of the truth], and they are arrogant.
rows.transliteration: ilāhukum ilāhun wāḥid ۚ fal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati qulūbuhum munkiratun wahum mustakbirūn

rows.arabic: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُسْتَكْبِرِينَ
rows.translation: Undoubtedly, Allah knows whatever they hide and whatever they disclose. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
rows.transliteration: lā jarama annallāha ya`lamu mā yusirrūna wa mā yu`linūn ۚ innahu lā yuḥibbul mustakbirīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُم مَّاذَآ أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۙ قَالُوٓا۟ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: When they are asked, ‘What is it that your Lord has sent down?’ They say, ‘Myths of the ancients,’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā qīla lahum mādhā anzala rabbukum qālū asāṭīrul-awwalīn

rows.arabic: لِيَحْمِلُوٓا۟ أَوْزَارَهُمْ كَامِلَةً يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ وَمِنْ أَوْزَارِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُضِلُّونَهُم بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۗ أَلَا سَآءَ مَا يَزِرُونَ
rows.translation: [with the result] that they will bear the full weight of their own burden on the Day of Resurrection, along with part of the burden of those whom they mislead without any knowledge. Behold! Evil is what they bear!
rows.transliteration: liyaḥmilū awzārahum kāmilatan yawmal qiyāmati wa min awzāril ladhīna yuḍillūnahum bighayri `il-m ۗ alā sā-a mā yazirūn

rows.arabic: قَدْ مَكَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ فَأَتَى ٱللَّهُ بُنْيَـٰنَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْقَوَاعِدِ فَخَرَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلسَّقْفُ مِن فَوْقِهِمْ وَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Those who were before them [had also] schemed. Then Allah came at their edifice from the foundations and the roof fell down upon them from above and the punishment overtook them whence they were not aware.
rows.transliteration: qad makaral ladhīna min qablihim fa-atallāhu bunyānahum minal qawā`idi fakharra `alayhimus saqfu min fawqihim wa-atāhumul `adhābu min ḥaythu lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يُخْزِيهِمْ وَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَآءِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تُشَـٰٓقُّونَ فِيهِمْ ۚ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ إِنَّ ٱلْخِزْىَ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَٱلسُّوٓءَ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them, and say, ‘Where are My “partners” for whose sake you used to defy [Allah]?’ Those who were given knowledge will say, ‘Indeed today disgrace and distress pursue the faithless.’
rows.transliteration: thumma yawmal qiyāmati yukhzīhim wayaqūlu ayna shurakā-iyal ladhīna kuntum tushāqqūna fīhim ۚ qālal ladhīna ūtul `il-ma innal khizyal yawma was sū a `alal-kāfirīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ تَتَوَفَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ ظَالِمِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ فَأَلْقَوُا۟ ٱلسَّلَمَ مَا كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ مِن سُوٓءٍۭ ۚ بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: —Those whom the angels take away while they were wronging themselves. Thereat they submit: ‘We were not doing any evil!’ ‘Yes, [the angels say to them,] indeed Allah knows best what you used to do!
rows.transliteration: alladhīna tatawaffāhumul malā-ikatu ẓālimī anfusihim ۖ fa-alqawus salama mā kunnā na`malu min sū-ī ۚ balā innallāha `alīmun bimā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: فَٱدْخُلُوٓا۟ أَبْوَٰبَ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ فَلَبِئْسَ مَثْوَى ٱلْمُتَكَبِّرِينَ
rows.translation: Enter the gates of hell to remain in it [forever]. Evil is the [final] abode of the arrogant.’
rows.transliteration: fadkhulū abwāba jahannama khālidīna fīhā ۖ falabi-sa mathwal mutakabbirīn

rows.arabic: وَقِيلَ لِلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوْا۟ مَاذَآ أَنزَلَ رَبُّكُمْ ۚ قَالُوا۟ خَيْرًا ۗ لِّلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةٌ ۚ وَلَدَارُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌ ۚ وَلَنِعْمَ دَارُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: But those who were Godwary will be asked, ‘What is it that your Lord has sent down?’ They will say, ‘Good.’ For those who do good in this world there will be a good [reward], and the abode of the Hereafter is better, and the abode of the Godwary is surely excellent:
rows.transliteration: waqīla lilladhīnat-taqaw mādhā anzala rabbukum ۚ qālū khayrā ۗ lilladhīna aḥsanū fī hādhihid dunyā ḥasanah ۚ waladārul-ākhirati khayr ۚ walani`ma dārul muttaqīn

rows.arabic: جَنَّـٰتُ عَدْنٍ يَدْخُلُونَهَا تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَآءُونَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَجْزِى ٱللَّهُ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: the Gardens of Eden, which they will enter, with streams running in them. There they will have whatever they wish, and thus does Allah reward the Godwary
rows.transliteration: jannātu `adniy yadkhulūnahā tajrī min taḥtihal-anhār ۖ lahum fīhā mā yashā-ūn ۚ kadhālika yajzillāhul muttaqīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ تَتَوَفَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ طَيِّبِينَ ۙ يَقُولُونَ سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: —those whom the angels take away while they are pure. They say [to them], ‘Peace be to you! Enter paradise because of what you used to do.’
rows.transliteration: alladhīna tatawaffāhumul malā-ikatu ṭayyibīna yaqūlūna salāmun `alaykumud-khulul jannata bimā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ أَوْ يَأْتِىَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ فَعَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Do they not consider that the angels may come to them, or your Lord’s edict may come? Those who were before them had acted likewise; Allah did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
rows.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna illā an ta-tiyahumul malā-ikatu aw ya-tiya amru rabbik ۚ kadhālika fa`alal ladhīna min qablihim ۚ wa mā ẓalamahumullāhu walākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: فَأَصَابَهُمْ سَيِّـَٔاتُ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
rows.translation: So the evils of what they had earned visited them, and they were besieged by what they used to deride.
rows.transliteration: fa-aṣābahum sayyi-ātu mā `amilū waḥāqa bihim mā kānū bihi yastahzi-ūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ لَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا عَبَدْنَا مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَىْءٍ نَّحْنُ وَلَآ ءَابَآؤُنَا وَلَا حَرَّمْنَا مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَىْءٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ فَعَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ فَهَلْ عَلَى ٱلرُّسُلِ إِلَّا ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
rows.translation: The polytheists say, ‘Had Allah wished, we would not have worshiped anything besides Him—neither we, nor our fathers—nor we would have forbidden anything without His sanction.’ Those who were before them had acted likewise. Is the apostles’ duty anything but to communicate in clear terms?
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna ashrakū law shā-allāhu mā `abadnā min dūnihi min shay-in naḥnu walā ābā-unā walā ḥarramnā min dūnihi min shay-ī ۚ kadhālika fa`alal ladhīna min qablihim ۚ fahal `alar rusuli illal-balāghul mubīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ بَعَثْنَا فِى كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَّسُولًا أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱجْتَنِبُوا۟ ٱلطَّـٰغُوتَ ۖ فَمِنْهُم مَّنْ هَدَى ٱللَّهُ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ حَقَّتْ عَلَيْهِ ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةُ ۚ فَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
rows.translation: Certainly We raised an apostle in every nation [to preach:] ‘Worship Allah, and shun fake deities.’ Among them were some whom Allah guided, and among them were some who deserved to be in error. So travel over the land and observe how was the fate of the deniers.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ba`athnā fī kulli ummatin rasūlan ani'-budullāha wajtanibuṭ ṭāghūt ۖ faminhum man hadallāhu wa minhum man ḥaqqat `alayhiḍ ḍalālah ۚ fasīrū fil-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul mukadhhibīn

rows.arabic: إِن تَحْرِصْ عَلَىٰ هُدَىٰهُمْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى مَن يُضِلُّ ۖ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّـٰصِرِينَ
rows.translation: Even if you are eager for them to be guided, indeed Allah does not guide those who mislead [others], and they will have no helpers.
rows.transliteration: in taḥriṣ `alā hudāhum fa-innallāha lā yahdī man yuḍill ۖ wa mā lahum min nāṣirīn

rows.arabic: وَأَقْسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ ۙ لَا يَبْعَثُ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَمُوتُ ۚ بَلَىٰ وَعْدًا عَلَيْهِ حَقًّا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: They swear by Allah with solemn oaths that Allah will not resurrect those who die. Yes indeed [He will], it is a promise binding upon Him, but most people do not know,
rows.transliteration: wa-aqsamū billāhi jahda aymānihim lā yab`athullāhu man yamūt ۚ balā wa`dan `alayhi ḥaqqan walākinna aktharan nāsi lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: لِيُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ وَلِيَعْلَمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ كَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: so that He may clarify for them what they differ about, and that the faithless may know that they were liars.
rows.transliteration: liyubayyina lahumul ladhī yakhtalifūna fīhi waliya`lamal ladhīna kafarū annahum kānū kādhibīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا قَوْلُنَا لِشَىْءٍ إِذَآ أَرَدْنَـٰهُ أَن نَّقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
rows.translation: All that We say to a thing, when We will it, is to say to it ‘Be!’ and it is.
rows.transliteration: innamā qawlunā lishay-in idhā aradnāhu an naqūla lahu kun fayakūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ فِى ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ لَنُبَوِّئَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً ۖ وَلَأَجْرُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Those who migrate for the sake of Allah after they have been wronged, We will surely settle them in a good place in the world, and the reward of the Hereafter is surely greater, had they known
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna hājarū fillāhi min ba`di mā ẓulimū lanubawwi-annahum fid dunyā ḥasanah ۖ wala-ajrul-ākhirati akbar ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
rows.translation: —those who are patient and who put their trust in their Lord.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna ṣabarū wa`alā rabbihim yatawakkalūn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًا نُّوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ فَسْـَٔلُوٓا۟ أَهْلَ ٱلذِّكْرِ إِن كُنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: We did not send [any apostles] before you except as men to whom We revealed. Ask the People of the Reminder if you do not know.
rows.transliteration: wa mā arsalnā min qablika illā rijālan nūḥī ilayhim ۚ fas-alū ahladh dhikri in kuntum lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَٱلزُّبُرِ ۗ وَأَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ٱلذِّكْرَ لِتُبَيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ مَا نُزِّلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: [We sent them] with manifest proofs and scriptures. We have sent down the reminder to you so that you may clarify for the people that which has been sent down to them, so that they may reflect.
rows.transliteration: bil bayyināti waz zubur ۗ wa-anzalnā ilaykadh dhikra litubayyina linnāsi mā nuzzila ilayhim wala`allahum yatafakkarūn

rows.arabic: أَفَأَمِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَكَرُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ أَن يَخْسِفَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِمُ ٱلْأَرْضَ أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: Do those who devise evil schemes feel secure that Allah will not make the earth swallow them, or the punishment will not overtake them whence they are not aware?
rows.transliteration: afa-aminal ladhīna makarus sayyi-āti an yakhsifallāhu bihimul-arḍa aw ya-tiyahumul `adhābu min ḥaythu lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: أَوْ يَأْخُذَهُمْ فِى تَقَلُّبِهِمْ فَمَا هُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
rows.translation: Or that He will not seize them in the midst of their bustle, whereupon they will not be able to frustrate [Him]?
rows.transliteration: aw ya-khudhahum fī taqallubihim famā hum bimu`jizīn

rows.arabic: أَوْ يَأْخُذَهُمْ عَلَىٰ تَخَوُّفٍ فَإِنَّ رَبَّكُمْ لَرَءُوفٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Or that He will not visit them with attrition? Indeed your Lord is most kind and merciful.
rows.transliteration: aw ya-khudhahum `alā takhawwufin fa-inna rabbakum lara-ūfun raḥīm

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ مِن شَىْءٍ يَتَفَيَّؤُا۟ ظِلَـٰلُهُۥ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَٱلشَّمَآئِلِ سُجَّدًا لِّلَّهِ وَهُمْ دَٰخِرُونَ
rows.translation: Have they not regarded that whatever thing Allah has created casts its shadow to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah in utter humility?
rows.transliteration: awalam yaraw ilā mā khalaqallāhu min shay-in yatafayya-u ẓilāluhu `anil yamīni wash shamā-ili sujjadal lillāhi wahum dākhirūn

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ يَسْجُدُ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِن دَآبَّةٍ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ وَهُمْ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
rows.translation: To Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, including animals and angels, and they are not arrogant.
rows.transliteration: walillāhi yasjudu mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍi min dābbatin wal malā-ikatu wahum lā yastakbirūn

rows.arabic: يَخَافُونَ رَبَّهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ ۩
rows.translation: They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are commanded.
rows.transliteration: yakhāfūna rabbahum min fawqihim wayaf`alūna mā yu-marūn ۩

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱللَّهُ لَا تَتَّخِذُوٓا۟ إِلَـٰهَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ ۖ إِنَّمَا هُوَ إِلَـٰهٌ وَٰحِدٌ ۖ فَإِيَّـٰىَ فَٱرْهَبُونِ
rows.translation: Allah has said, ‘Do not worship two gods. Indeed He is the One God, so be in awe of Me [alone].’
rows.transliteration: waqālallāhu lā tattakhidhū ilāhaynith-nayn ۖ innamā huwa ilāhun wāḥid ۖ fa-iyyāya farhabūn

rows.arabic: وَلَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَهُ ٱلدِّينُ وَاصِبًا ۚ أَفَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him belongs the enduring religion. Will you, then, be wary of other than Allah?
rows.transliteration: walahu mā fis samāwāti wal-arḍi walahud dīnu wāṣibā ۚ afaghayrallāhi tattaqūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا بِكُم مِّن نِّعْمَةٍ فَمِنَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِذَا مَسَّكُمُ ٱلضُّرُّ فَإِلَيْهِ تَجْـَٔرُونَ
rows.translation: Whatever blessing you have is from Allah, and when a distress befalls you, you make entreaties to Him.
rows.transliteration: wa mā bikum min ni`matin faminallāh ۖ thumma idhā massakumuḍ ḍurru fa-ilayhi taj-arūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا كَشَفَ ٱلضُّرَّ عَنكُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌ مِّنكُم بِرَبِّهِمْ يُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: Then, when He removes the distress from you—behold, a part of them ascribe partners to their Lord,
rows.transliteration: thumma idhā kashafaḍ ḍurra `ankum idhā farīqun minkum birabbihim yushrikūn

rows.arabic: لِيَكْفُرُوا۟ بِمَآ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمْ ۚ فَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: being unthankful for what We have given them. So let them enjoy. Soon they shall know!
rows.transliteration: liyakfurū bimā ātaynāhum ۚ fatamatta`ū ۖ fasawfa ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِمَا لَا يَعْلَمُونَ نَصِيبًا مِّمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ تَٱللَّهِ لَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ عَمَّا كُنتُمْ تَفْتَرُونَ
rows.translation: They assign a share in what We have provided them to what they do not know. By Allah, you will surely be questioned concerning what you used to fabricate.
rows.transliteration: wayaj`alūna limā lā ya`lamūna naṣīban mimmā razaqnāhum ۗ tallāhi latus-alunna `ammā kuntum taftarūn

rows.arabic: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِلَّهِ ٱلْبَنَـٰتِ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۙ وَلَهُم مَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
rows.translation: And they attribute daughters to Allah—immaculate is He—while they will have what they desire!
rows.transliteration: wayaj`alūna lillāhil banāti subḥānahu walahum mā yashtahūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا بُشِّرَ أَحَدُهُم بِٱلْأُنثَىٰ ظَلَّ وَجْهُهُۥ مُسْوَدًّا وَهُوَ كَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: When one of them is brought the news of a female [newborn], his face becomes darkened, and he chokes with suppressed agony.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā bushhira aḥaduhum bil-unthā ẓalla wajhuhu muswaddan wahuwa kaẓīm

rows.arabic: يَتَوَٰرَىٰ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْمِ مِن سُوٓءِ مَا بُشِّرَ بِهِۦٓ ۚ أَيُمْسِكُهُۥ عَلَىٰ هُونٍ أَمْ يَدُسُّهُۥ فِى ٱلتُّرَابِ ۗ أَلَا سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
rows.translation: He hides from the people out of distress at the news he has been brought: shall he retain it in humiliation, or bury it in the ground! Behold! Evil is the judgement that they make.
rows.transliteration: yatawārā minal qawmi min sū-i mā bushhira bih ۚ ayumsikuhu `alā hūnin am yadussuhu fit turāb ۗ alā sā-a mā yaḥkumūn

rows.arabic: لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مَثَلُ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۖ وَلِلَّهِ ٱلْمَثَلُ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
rows.translation: There is an evil description for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, and the loftiest description belongs to Allah, and He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
rows.transliteration: lilladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati mathalus saw-i ۖ walillāhil mathalul-a`lā ۚ wahuwal `azīzul ḥakīm

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ يُؤَاخِذُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلنَّاسَ بِظُلْمِهِم مَّا تَرَكَ عَلَيْهَا مِن دَآبَّةٍ وَلَـٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ لَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ سَاعَةً ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
rows.translation: Were Allah to take mankind to task for their wrongdoing, He would not leave any living being upon it. But He respites them until a specified time; so when their time comes they shall not defer it by a single hour nor shall they advance it.
rows.transliteration: walaw yu-ākhidhullāhun nāsa biẓul-mihim mā taraka `alayhā min dābbatin walākin yu-akhhiruhum ilā ajalin musammā ۖ fa-idhā jā-a ajaluhum lā yasta-khirūna sā`ah ۖ walā yastaqdimūn

rows.arabic: وَيَجْعَلُونَ لِلَّهِ مَا يَكْرَهُونَ وَتَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُهُمُ ٱلْكَذِبَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۖ لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّ لَهُمُ ٱلنَّارَ وَأَنَّهُم مُّفْرَطُونَ
rows.translation: They attribute to Allah what they dislike [for themselves], and their tongues assert the lie that the best of rewards [in the Hereafter] will be theirs. Undoubtedly, the Fire shall be their lot and they will be foremost [in entering it].
rows.transliteration: wayaj`alūna lillāhi mā yakrahūna wataṣifu alsinatuhumul kadhiba anna lahumul ḥusnā ۖ lā jarama anna lahumun nāra wa-annahum mufraṭūn

rows.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمَمٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: By Allah, We have certainly sent [apostles] to nations before you. But Satan made their deeds seem decorous to them. So he is their master today and there is a painful punishment for them.
rows.transliteration: tallāhi laqad arsalnā ilā umamin min qablika fazayyana lahumush shayṭānu a`mālahum fahuwa waliyyuhumul yawma walahum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ إِلَّا لِتُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فِيهِ ۙ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: We did not send down the Book to you except [for the purpose] that you may clarify for them what they differ about, and as a guidance and mercy for a people who have faith.
rows.transliteration: wa mā anzalnā `alaykal kitāba illā litubayyina lahumul ladhikh-talafū fīhi wahudan waraḥmatan liqawmiy yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَحْيَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَآ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَسْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: Allah sends down water from the sky with which He revives the earth after its death. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who listen.
rows.transliteration: wallāhu anzala minas samā-i mā-an fa-aḥyā bihil-arḍa ba`da mawtihā ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy yasma`ūn

rows.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ لَعِبْرَةً ۖ نُّسْقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِى بُطُونِهِۦ مِنۢ بَيْنِ فَرْثٍ وَدَمٍ لَّبَنًا خَالِصًا سَآئِغًا لِّلشَّـٰرِبِينَ
rows.translation: There is indeed a lesson for you in the cattle: We give you a drink pleasant to those who drink, pure milk, which is in their bellies, between [intestinal] waste and blood.
rows.transliteration: wa inna lakum fil-an`āmi la`ibrah ۖ nusqīkum mimmā fī buṭūnihi min bayni farthin wadamin labanan khāliṣan sā-ighal lishhāribīn

rows.arabic: وَمِن ثَمَرَٰتِ ٱلنَّخِيلِ وَٱلْأَعْنَـٰبِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِنْهُ سَكَرًا وَرِزْقًا حَسَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
rows.translation: From the fruits of date palms and vines you draw wine and goodly provision. There are indeed signs in that for people who exercise their reason.
rows.transliteration: wa min thamarātin nakhīli wal-a`nābi tattakhidhūna minhu sakaran warizqan ḥasanā ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy ya`qilūn

rows.arabic: وَأَوْحَىٰ رَبُّكَ إِلَى ٱلنَّحْلِ أَنِ ٱتَّخِذِى مِنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا وَمِنَ ٱلشَّجَرِ وَمِمَّا يَعْرِشُونَ
rows.translation: And your Lord inspired the bee [saying]: ‘Make your home in the mountains, and on the trees and the trellises that they erect.
rows.transliteration: wa-awḥā rabbuka ilan naḥli anit-takhidhī minal jibāli buyūtan wa minash shajari wa mimmā ya`rishūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ كُلِى مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ فَٱسْلُكِى سُبُلَ رَبِّكِ ذُلُلًا ۚ يَخْرُجُ مِنۢ بُطُونِهَا شَرَابٌ مُّخْتَلِفٌ أَلْوَٰنُهُۥ فِيهِ شِفَآءٌ لِّلنَّاسِ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Then eat from every [kind of] fruit and follow meekly the ways of your Lord.’ There issues from its belly a juice of diverse hues, in which there is a cure for the people. There is indeed a sign in that for a people who reflect.
rows.transliteration: thumma kulī min kullith thamarāti faslukī subula rabbiki dhululā ۚ yakhruju min buṭūnihā sharābun mukhtalifun alwānuhu fīhi shifā-un linnās ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy yatafakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمْ ثُمَّ يَتَوَفَّىٰكُمْ ۚ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَرْذَلِ ٱلْعُمُرِ لِكَىْ لَا يَعْلَمَ بَعْدَ عِلْمٍ شَيْـًٔا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: Allah has created you, then He takes you away, and there are some among you who are relegated to the nethermost age so that he knows nothing after [having possessed] some knowledge. Indeed Allah is all-knowing, all-powerful.
rows.transliteration: wallāhu khalaqakum thumma yatawaffākum ۚ wa minkum man yuraddu ilā ardhalil `umuri likay lā ya`lama ba`da `il-min shay-ā ۚ innallāha `alīmun qadīr

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ فَضَّلَ بَعْضَكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ فِى ٱلرِّزْقِ ۚ فَمَا ٱلَّذِينَ فُضِّلُوا۟ بِرَآدِّى رِزْقِهِمْ عَلَىٰ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَـٰنُهُمْ فَهُمْ فِيهِ سَوَآءٌ ۚ أَفَبِنِعْمَةِ ٱللَّهِ يَجْحَدُونَ
rows.translation: Allah has granted some of you an advantage over others in [respect of] provision. Those who have been granted an advantage do not give over their provision to their slaves so that they become equal in its respect. What, do they deny the blessing of Allah?
rows.transliteration: wallāhu faḍḍala ba`ḍakum `alā ba`ḍin fir rizq ۚ famal ladhīna fuḍḍilū birāddī rizqihim `alā mā malakat aymānuhum fahum fīhi sawā-u ۚ afabini`matil lāhi yajḥadūn

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَنفُسِكُمْ أَزْوَٰجًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم بَنِينَ وَحَفَدَةً وَرَزَقَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ ۚ أَفَبِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ يُؤْمِنُونَ وَبِنِعْمَتِ ٱللَّهِ هُمْ يَكْفُرُونَ
rows.translation: Allah made for you mates from your own selves and appointed for you children and grandchildren from your mates, and We provided you with all the good things. What, do they believe in falsehood while they deny the blessing of Allah?
rows.transliteration: wallāhu ja`ala lakum min anfusikum azwājan waja`ala lakum min azwājikum banīna waḥafadatan warazaqakum minaṭ ṭayyibāt ۚ afabil bāṭili yu-minūna wabini`matillāhi hum yakfurūn

rows.arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَمْلِكُ لَهُمْ رِزْقًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ شَيْـًٔا وَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
rows.translation: They worship besides Allah what has no power to provide them with anything from the heavens and the earth, nor are they capable [of anything].
rows.transliteration: waya`budūna min dūnillāhi mā lā yamliku lahum rizqan minas samāwāti wal-arḍi shay-an walā yastaṭī`ūn

rows.arabic: فَلَا تَضْرِبُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلْأَمْثَالَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: So do not draw comparisons for Allah: indeed Allah knows and you do not know.
rows.transliteration: falā taḍribū lillāhil-amthāl ۚ innallāha ya`lamu wa-antum lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: ضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًا عَبْدًا مَّمْلُوكًا لَّا يَقْدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍ وَمَن رَّزَقْنَـٰهُ مِنَّا رِزْقًا حَسَنًا فَهُوَ يُنفِقُ مِنْهُ سِرًّا وَجَهْرًا ۖ هَلْ يَسْتَوُۥنَ ۚ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Allah draws a parable: a slave owned [by his master] who has no power over anything, and another one [a free man] whom We have provided a goodly provision and who spends out of it secretly and openly. Are they equal? All praise belongs to Allah. But most of them do not know.
rows.transliteration: ḍaraballāhu mathalan `abdan mamlūkal lā yaqdiru `alā shay-in wa man razaqnāhu minnā rizqan ḥasanan fahuwa yunfiqu minhu sirran wajahrā ۖ hal yastawūn ۚ al-ḥamdu lillāh ۚ bal aktharuhum lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًا رَّجُلَيْنِ أَحَدُهُمَآ أَبْكَمُ لَا يَقْدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَىْءٍ وَهُوَ كَلٌّ عَلَىٰ مَوْلَىٰهُ أَيْنَمَا يُوَجِّههُّ لَا يَأْتِ بِخَيْرٍ ۖ هَلْ يَسْتَوِى هُوَ وَمَن يَأْمُرُ بِٱلْعَدْلِ ۙ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
rows.translation: Allah draws [another] parable: Two men, one of whom is dumb, having no power over anything and who is a liability to his master: wherever he directs him he does not bring any good. Is he equal to someone who enjoins justice and is [steady] on a straight path?
rows.transliteration: waḍaraballāhu mathalan rajulayni aḥaduhumā abkamu lā yaqdiru `alā shay-in wahuwa kallun `alā mawlāhu aynamā yuwajjih-hu lā ya-ti bikhayr ۖ hal yastawī huwa wa man ya-muru bil `adli wahuwa `alā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ غَيْبُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَآ أَمْرُ ٱلسَّاعَةِ إِلَّا كَلَمْحِ ٱلْبَصَرِ أَوْ هُوَ أَقْرَبُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
rows.translation: To Allah belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. The matter of the Hour is just like the twinkling of an eye, or [even] swifter. Indeed Allah has power over all things.
rows.transliteration: walillāhi ghaybus samāwāti wal-arḍ ۚ wa mā amrus sā`ati illā kalamḥil baṣari aw huwa aqrab ۚ innallāha `alā kulli shay-in qadīr

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَخْرَجَكُم مِّنۢ بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ شَيْـًٔا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَٱلْأَبْصَـٰرَ وَٱلْأَفْـِٔدَةَ ۙ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: Allah has brought you forth from the bellies of your mothers while you did not know anything. He made for you hearing, eyesight, and hearts so that you may give thanks.
rows.transliteration: wallāhu akhrajakum min buṭūni ummahātikum lā ta`lamūna shay-an waja`ala lakumus sam`a wal-abṣāra wal-af-idata la`allakum tashkurūn

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيْرِ مُسَخَّرَٰتٍ فِى جَوِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Have they not regarded the birds disposed in the air of the sky: no one sustains them except Allah. There are indeed signs in that for a people who have faith.
rows.transliteration: alam yaraw ilaṭ ṭayri musakhharātin fī jawwis samā-i mā yumsikuhunna illallāh ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنۢ بُيُوتِكُمْ سَكَنًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّن جُلُودِ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ بُيُوتًا تَسْتَخِفُّونَهَا يَوْمَ ظَعْنِكُمْ وَيَوْمَ إِقَامَتِكُمْ ۙ وَمِنْ أَصْوَافِهَا وَأَوْبَارِهَا وَأَشْعَارِهَآ أَثَـٰثًا وَمَتَـٰعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: It is Allah who has made your homes as a place of rest for you and He made for you homes out of the skins of the cattle which you find portable on the day of your shifting and on the day of your halt, and out of their wool, fur and hair [He has appointed] furniture and wares [enduring] for a while.
rows.transliteration: wallāhu ja`ala lakum min buyūtikum sakanan waja`ala lakum min julūdil-an`āmi buyūtan tastakhiffūnahā yawma ẓa`nikum wayawma iqāmatikum wa min aṣwāfihā wa-awbārihā wa-ash`ārihā athāthan wa matā`an ilā ḥīn

rows.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّمَّا خَلَقَ ظِلَـٰلًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْجِبَالِ أَكْنَـٰنًا وَجَعَلَ لَكُمْ سَرَٰبِيلَ تَقِيكُمُ ٱلْحَرَّ وَسَرَٰبِيلَ تَقِيكُم بَأْسَكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُتِمُّ نِعْمَتَهُۥ عَلَيْكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: It is Allah who made for you the shade from what He has created, and made for you retreats in the mountains, and made for you garments that protect you from heat, and garments that protect you from your [mutual] violence. That is how He completes His blessing upon you so that you may submit [to Him].
rows.transliteration: wallāhu ja`ala lakum mimmā khalaqa ẓilālan waja`ala lakum minal jibāli aknānan waja`ala lakum sarābīla taqīkumul ḥarra wasarābīla taqīkum ba-sakum ۚ kadhālika yutimmu ni`matahu `alaykum la`allakum tuslimūn

rows.arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْبَلَـٰغُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
rows.translation: But if they turn their backs [on you], your duty is only to communicate in clear terms.
rows.transliteration: fa-in tawallaw fa-innamā `alaykal balāghul mubīn

rows.arabic: يَعْرِفُونَ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ يُنكِرُونَهَا وَأَكْثَرُهُمُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: They recognize the blessing of Allah and then deny it, and most of them are faithless.
rows.transliteration: ya`rifūna ni`matallāhi thumma yunkirūnahā wa-aktharuhumul kāfirūn

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَبْعَثُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهِيدًا ثُمَّ لَا يُؤْذَنُ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ
rows.translation: The day We shall raise a witness from every nation, the faithless will not be permitted [to speak], nor will they be asked to propitiate [Allah].
rows.transliteration: wayawma nab`athu min kulli ummatin shahīdan thumma lā yu-dhanu lilladhīna kafarū walā hum yusta`tabūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا رَءَا ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ فَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
rows.translation: And when the wrongdoers sight the punishment, it shall not be lightened for them, nor will they be granted any respite.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā ra al ladhīna ẓalamul `adhāba falā yukhaffafu `anhum walā hum yunẓarūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا رَءَا ٱلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوا۟ شُرَكَآءَهُمْ قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ شُرَكَآؤُنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كُنَّا نَدْعُوا۟ مِن دُونِكَ ۖ فَأَلْقَوْا۟ إِلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقَوْلَ إِنَّكُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
rows.translation: When the polytheists sight their partners, they will say, ‘Our Lord! These are our partners whom we used to invoke besides You.’ But they will retort to them, ‘You are indeed liars!’
rows.transliteration: wa idhā ra al ladhīna ashrakū shurakā-ahum qālū rabbanā hā-ulā-i shurakā-unal ladhīna kunnā nad`ū min dūnik ۖ fa-alqaw ilayhimul qawla innakum lakādhibūn

rows.arabic: وَأَلْقَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلسَّلَمَ ۖ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
rows.translation: They will submit to Allah on that day, and what they used to fabricate will forsake them.
rows.transliteration: wa-alqaw ilallāhi yawma-idhinis salam ۖ waḍalla `anhum mā kānū yaftarūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَصَدُّوا۟ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ زِدْنَـٰهُمْ عَذَابًا فَوْقَ ٱلْعَذَابِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يُفْسِدُونَ
rows.translation: Those who are faithless and bar from the way of Allah—We shall add punishment to their punishment because of the corruption they used to cause.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna kafarū waṣaddū `an sabīlillāhi zidnāhum `adhāban fawqal `adhābi bimā kānū yufsidūn

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَبْعَثُ فِى كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ شَهِيدًا عَلَيْهِم مِّنْ أَنفُسِهِمْ ۖ وَجِئْنَا بِكَ شَهِيدًا عَلَىٰ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ۚ وَنَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ تِبْيَـٰنًا لِّكُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: The day We raise in every nation a witness against them from among themselves, We shall bring you as a witness against these. We have sent down the Book to you as a clarification of all things and as guidance, mercy and good news for the Muslims.
rows.transliteration: wayawma nab`athu fī kulli ummatin shahīdan `alayhim min anfusihim ۖ waji-nā bika shahīdan `alā hā-ulā-i ۚ wanazzalnā `alaykal kitāba tibyānal likulli shay-in wahudan waraḥmatan wabushrā lil-muslimīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأْمُرُ بِٱلْعَدْلِ وَٱلْإِحْسَـٰنِ وَإِيتَآئِ ذِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَيَنْهَىٰ عَنِ ٱلْفَحْشَآءِ وَٱلْمُنكَرِ وَٱلْبَغْىِ ۚ يَعِظُكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed Allah enjoins justice and kindness, and generosity towards relatives, and He forbids indecency, wrongdoing, and aggression. He advises you, so that you may take admonition.
rows.transliteration: innallāha ya-muru bil `adli wal-iḥsāni wa-iytā-i dhil qurbā wayanhā `anil faḥshā-i wal munkari wal baghyi ۚ ya`iẓukum la`allakum tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَأَوْفُوا۟ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ إِذَا عَـٰهَدتُّمْ وَلَا تَنقُضُوا۟ ٱلْأَيْمَـٰنَ بَعْدَ تَوْكِيدِهَا وَقَدْ جَعَلْتُمُ ٱللَّهَ عَلَيْكُمْ كَفِيلًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
rows.translation: Fulfill Allah’s covenant when you pledge, and do not break [your] oaths, after pledging them solemnly and having made Allah a witness over yourselves. Indeed Allah knows what you do.
rows.transliteration: wa-awfū bi`ahdillāhi idhā `āhadtum walā tanquḍul-aymāna ba`da tawkīdihā waqad ja`altumullāha `alaykum kafīlā ۚ innallāha ya`lamu mā taf`alūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّتِى نَقَضَتْ غَزْلَهَا مِنۢ بَعْدِ قُوَّةٍ أَنكَـٰثًا تَتَّخِذُونَ أَيْمَـٰنَكُمْ دَخَلًۢا بَيْنَكُمْ أَن تَكُونَ أُمَّةٌ هِىَ أَرْبَىٰ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ ۚ إِنَّمَا يَبْلُوكُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦ ۚ وَلَيُبَيِّنَنَّ لَكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ مَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
rows.translation: Do not be like her who would undo her yarn, breaking it up after [spinning it to] strength, by making your oaths a means of [mutual] deceit among yourselves, so that one community may become more affluent than another community. Indeed Allah tests you thereby, and He will surely clarify for you on the Day of Resurrection what you used to differ about.
rows.transliteration: walā takūnū kal latī naqaḍat ghazlahā min ba`di quwwatin ankāthan tattakhidhūna aymānakum dakhalan baynakum an takūna ummatun hiya arbā min ummah ۚ innamā yablūkumullāhu bih ۚ walayubayyinanna lakum yawmal qiyāmati mā kuntum fīhi takhtalifūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَجَعَلَكُمْ أُمَّةً وَٰحِدَةً وَلَـٰكِن يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَلَتُسْـَٔلُنَّ عَمَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Had Allah wished, He would have made you one community, but He leads astray whomever He wishes and guides whomever He wishes, and you will surely be questioned concerning what you used to do.
rows.transliteration: walaw shā-allāhu laja`alakum ummatan wāḥidatan walākin yuḍillu man yashā-u wayahdī man yashā-u ۚ walatus-alunna `ammā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَتَّخِذُوٓا۟ أَيْمَـٰنَكُمْ دَخَلًۢا بَيْنَكُمْ فَتَزِلَّ قَدَمٌۢ بَعْدَ ثُبُوتِهَا وَتَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِمَا صَدَدتُّمْ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَلَكُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Do not make your oaths a means of [mutual] deceit among yourselves, lest feet should stumble after being steady and [lest] you suffer ill for barring from the way of Allah and face a great punishment.
rows.transliteration: walā tattakhidhū aymānakum dakhalan baynakum fatazilla qadamun ba`da thubūtihā watadhūqus sū a bimā ṣadadtum `an sabīlillāh ۖ walakum `adhābun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَشْتَرُوا۟ بِعَهْدِ ٱللَّهِ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Do not sell Allah’s covenants for a paltry gain. Indeed, what is with Allah is better for you, should you know.
rows.transliteration: walā tashtarū bi`ahdillāhi thamanan qalīlā ۚ innamā `indallāhi huwa khayrul lakum in kuntum ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: مَا عِندَكُمْ يَنفَدُ ۖ وَمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ بَاقٍ ۗ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوٓا۟ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: That which is with you will be spent [and gone], but what is with Allah shall last, and We will surely pay the patient their reward by the best of what they used to do.
rows.transliteration: mā `indakum yanfad ۖ wa mā `indallāhi bāq ۗ walanajziyannal ladhīna ṣabarū ajrahum bi-aḥsani mā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: مَنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوْ أُنثَىٰ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌ فَلَنُحْيِيَنَّهُۥ حَيَوٰةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ وَلَنَجْزِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْرَهُم بِأَحْسَنِ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Whoever acts righteously, [whether] male or female, should he be faithful, We shall revive him with a good life and pay them their reward by the best of what they used to do.
rows.transliteration: man `amila ṣāliḥan min dhakarin aw unthā wahuwa mu-minun falanuḥyiyannahu ḥayātan ṭayyibah ۖ walanajziyannahum ajrahum bi-aḥsani mā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأْتَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ فَٱسْتَعِذْ بِٱللَّهِ مِنَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ
rows.translation: When you recite the Quran, seek the protection of Allah against the outcast Satan.
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā qara-tal qur-āna fasta`idh billāhi minash shayṭānir rajīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَيْسَ لَهُۥ سُلْطَـٰنٌ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ يَتَوَكَّلُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed he does not have any authority over those who have faith and put their trust in their Lord.
rows.transliteration: innahu laysa lahu sulṭānun `alal ladhīna āmanū wa`alā rabbihim yatawakkalūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا سُلْطَـٰنُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَوَلَّوْنَهُۥ وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِهِۦ مُشْرِكُونَ
rows.translation: His authority is only over those who befriend him and those who make him a partner [of Allah].
rows.transliteration: innamā sulṭānuhu `alal ladhīna yatawallawnahu wal ladhīna hum bihi mushrikūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا بَدَّلْنَآ ءَايَةً مَّكَانَ ءَايَةٍ ۙ وَٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُنَزِّلُ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُفْتَرٍۭ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: When We change a sign for another in its stead—and Allah knows best what He sends down—they say, ‘You are indeed a fabricator.’ Indeed, most of them do not know.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā baddalnā āyatan makāna āyatin wallāhu a`lamu bimā yunazzilu qālū innamā anta muftar ۚ bal aktharuhum lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ نَزَّلَهُۥ رُوحُ ٱلْقُدُسِ مِن رَّبِّكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ لِيُثَبِّتَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَهُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: Say, the Holy Spirit has brought it down duly from your Lord to fortify those who have faith and as guidance and good news for the Muslims.
rows.transliteration: qul nazzalahu rūḥul qudusi min rabbika bil ḥaqqi liyuthabbital ladhīna āmanū wahudan wabushrā lil-muslimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّمَا يُعَلِّمُهُۥ بَشَرٌ ۗ لِّسَانُ ٱلَّذِى يُلْحِدُونَ إِلَيْهِ أَعْجَمِىٌّ وَهَـٰذَا لِسَانٌ عَرَبِىٌّ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: We certainly know that they say, ‘It is only a human that instructs him.’ The language of him to whom they refer is non-Arabic, while this is a clear Arabic language.
rows.transliteration: walaqad na`lamu annahum yaqūlūna innamā yu`allimuhu bashar ۗ lisānul ladhī yulḥidūna ilayhi a`jamiyyun wahādhā lisānun `arabiyyun mubīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَا يَهْدِيهِمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: Indeed those who do not believe in the signs of Allah—Allah shall not guide them and there is a painful punishment for them.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bi-āyātillāhi lā yahdīhimullāhu walahum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَفْتَرِى ٱلْكَذِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْكَـٰذِبُونَ
rows.translation: Only those fabricate lies who do not believe in the signs of Allah, and it is they who are the liars.
rows.transliteration: innamā yaftaril kadhibal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bi-āyātillāh ۖ wa-ulā-ika humul kādhibūn

rows.arabic: مَن كَفَرَ بِٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ إِيمَـٰنِهِۦٓ إِلَّا مَنْ أُكْرِهَ وَقَلْبُهُۥ مُطْمَئِنٌّۢ بِٱلْإِيمَـٰنِ وَلَـٰكِن مَّن شَرَحَ بِٱلْكُفْرِ صَدْرًا فَعَلَيْهِمْ غَضَبٌ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: Excepting someone who is compelled [to recant his faith] while his heart is at rest in it, those who disbelieve in Allah after [affirming] their faith and open up their breasts to unfaith, Allah’s wrath shall be upon them and there is a great punishment for them.
rows.transliteration: man kafara billāhi min ba`di-iymānihi illā man ukriha waqalbuhu muṭma-innun bil-iymāni walākin man sharaḥa bil kufri ṣadran fa`alayhim ghaḍabun minallāhi walahum `adhābun `aẓīm

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمُ ٱسْتَحَبُّوا۟ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا عَلَى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: That, because they preferred the life of the world to the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the faithless lot.
rows.transliteration: dhālika bi-annahumus taḥabbul ḥayātad dunyā `alal-ākhirati wa-annallāha lā yahdil qawmal kāfirīn

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ طَبَعَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ وَسَمْعِهِمْ وَأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰفِلُونَ
rows.translation: They are the ones Allah has set a seal on their hearts, their hearing and their sight, and it is they who are the heedless.
rows.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna ṭaba`allāhu `alā qulūbihim wasam`ihim wa-abṣārihim ۖ wa-ulā-ika humul ghāfilūn

rows.arabic: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: Undoubtedly, they are the ones who will be the losers in the Hereafter.
rows.transliteration: lā jarama annahum fil-ākhirati humul khāsirūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا فُتِنُوا۟ ثُمَّ جَـٰهَدُوا۟ وَصَبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Thereafter your Lord will indeed be forgiving and merciful to those who migrated after they were persecuted, waged jihad and remained steadfast.
rows.transliteration: thumma inna rabbaka lilladhīna hājarū min ba`di mā futinū thumma jāhadū waṣabarū inna rabbaka min ba`dihā laghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ تَأْتِى كُلُّ نَفْسٍ تُجَـٰدِلُ عَن نَّفْسِهَا وَتُوَفَّىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا عَمِلَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: The day [will come] when every soul will come pleading for itself and every soul will be recompensed fully for what it has done, and they will not be wronged.
rows.transliteration: yawma ta-tī kullu nafsin tujādilu `an nafsihā watuwaffā kullu nafsin mā `amilat wahum lā yuẓlamūn

rows.arabic: وَضَرَبَ ٱللَّهُ مَثَلًا قَرْيَةً كَانَتْ ءَامِنَةً مُّطْمَئِنَّةً يَأْتِيهَا رِزْقُهَا رَغَدًا مِّن كُلِّ مَكَانٍ فَكَفَرَتْ بِأَنْعُمِ ٱللَّهِ فَأَذَٰقَهَا ٱللَّهُ لِبَاسَ ٱلْجُوعِ وَٱلْخَوْفِ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَصْنَعُونَ
rows.translation: Allah draws a parable: There was a town secure and peaceful, its provision coming abundantly from every place. But it was ungrateful toward Allah’s blessings. So Allah made it taste hunger and fear because of what they used to do.
rows.transliteration: waḍaraballāhu mathalan qaryatan kānat āminatan muṭma-innatan ya-tīhā rizquhā raghadan min kulli makānin fakafarat bi-an`umillāhi fa-adhāqahallāhu libāsal jū`i wal khawfi bimā kānū yaṣna`ūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُمْ رَسُولٌ مِّنْهُمْ فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَهُمْ ظَـٰلِمُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly there had come to them an apostle from among themselves, but they impugned him. So the punishment seized them while they were doing wrong.
rows.transliteration: walaqad jā-ahum rasūlun minhum fakadhhabūhu fa-akhadhahumul `adhābu wahum ẓālimūn

rows.arabic: فَكُلُوا۟ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ حَلَـٰلًا طَيِّبًا وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ نِعْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ إِيَّاهُ تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: So eat out of what Allah has provided you as lawful and good, and give thanks for Allah’s blessing, if it is Him that you worship.
rows.transliteration: fakulū mimmā razaqakumullāhu ḥalālan ṭayyiban washkurū ni`matallāhi in kuntum iyyāhu ta`budūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَيْتَةَ وَٱلدَّمَ وَلَحْمَ ٱلْخِنزِيرِ وَمَآ أُهِلَّ لِغَيْرِ ٱللَّهِ بِهِۦ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱضْطُرَّ غَيْرَ بَاغٍ وَلَا عَادٍ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: He has forbidden you only carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been offered to other than Allah. But if someone is compelled [to eat any of that], without being rebellious or aggressive, indeed Allah is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
rows.transliteration: innamā ḥarrama `alaykumul maytata wad dama walaḥmal khinzīri wa mā uhilla lighayrillāhi bih ۖ famaniḍ-ṭurra ghayra bāghin walā `ādin fa-innallāha ghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَقُولُوا۟ لِمَا تَصِفُ أَلْسِنَتُكُمُ ٱلْكَذِبَ هَـٰذَا حَلَـٰلٌ وَهَـٰذَا حَرَامٌ لِّتَفْتَرُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفْتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ لَا يُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Do not say, asserting falsely with your tongues, ‘This is lawful, and that is unlawful,’ attributing lies to Allah. Indeed those who attribute lies to Allah will not be felicitous.
rows.transliteration: walā taqūlū limā taṣifu alsinatukumul kadhiba hādhā ḥalālun wahādhā ḥarāmul litaftarū `alallāhil kadhib ۚ innal ladhīna yaftarūna `alallāhil kadhiba lā yufliḥūn

rows.arabic: مَتَـٰعٌ قَلِيلٌ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: [Their share of the present life is] a trifling enjoyment, and there will be a painful punishment for them.
rows.transliteration: matā`un qalīlun walahum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: وَعَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوا۟ حَرَّمْنَا مَا قَصَصْنَا عَلَيْكَ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ وَمَا ظَلَمْنَـٰهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: We forbade to the Jews what We have recounted to you earlier, and We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
rows.transliteration: wa`alal ladhīna hādū ḥarramnā mā qaṣaṣnā `alayka min qabl ۖ wa mā ẓalamnāhum walākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِجَهَـٰلَةٍ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Moreover, your Lord will indeed be forgiving and merciful to those who repent after they having committed evil out of ignorance and reform themselves.
rows.transliteration: thumma inna rabbaka lilladhīna `amilus sū a bijahālatin thumma tābū min ba`di dhālika wa-aṣlaḥū inna rabbaka min ba`dihā laghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ كَانَ أُمَّةً قَانِتًا لِّلَّهِ حَنِيفًا وَلَمْ يَكُ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: Indeed Abraham was a nation [all by himself], obedient to Allah, a Hanif, and he was not a polytheist.
rows.transliteration: inna ibrāhīma kāna ummatan qānital lillāhi ḥanīfan walam yaku minal mushrikīn

rows.arabic: شَاكِرًا لِّأَنْعُمِهِ ۚ ٱجْتَبَىٰهُ وَهَدَىٰهُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
rows.translation: Grateful [as he was] for His blessings, He chose him and guided him to a straight path.
rows.transliteration: shākiral li-an`umih ۚ ij-tabāhu wahadāhu ilā ṣirāṭin mustaqīm

rows.arabic: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
rows.translation: We gave him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the Righteous.
rows.transliteration: wa-ātaynāhu fid dunyā ḥasanah ۖ wa innahu fil-ākhirati laminaṣ ṣāliḥīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَيْكَ أَنِ ٱتَّبِعْ مِلَّةَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ حَنِيفًا ۖ وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُشْرِكِينَ
rows.translation: Thereafter We revealed to you [saying], ‘Follow the creed of Abraham, a Hanif, who was not a polytheist.’
rows.transliteration: thumma awḥaynā ilayka anit-tabi` millata ibrāhīma ḥanīfā ۖ wa mā kāna minal mushrikīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ ٱلسَّبْتُ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فِيهِ ۚ وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
rows.translation: The Sabbath was only prescribed for those who differed about it. Your Lord will indeed judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that about which they differ.
rows.transliteration: innamā ju`ilas sabtu `alal ladhīnakh-talafū fīh ۚ wa inna rabbaka layaḥkumu baynahum yawmal qiyāmati fīmā kānū fīhi yakhtalifūn

rows.arabic: ٱدْعُ إِلَىٰ سَبِيلِ رَبِّكَ بِٱلْحِكْمَةِ وَٱلْمَوْعِظَةِ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ ۖ وَجَـٰدِلْهُم بِٱلَّتِى هِىَ أَحْسَنُ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ ۖ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
rows.translation: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good advice and dispute with them in a manner that is best. Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.
rows.transliteration: ud-`u ilā sabīli rabbika bil ḥikmati wal maw`iẓatil ḥasanah ۖ wajādilhum bil latī hiya aḥsan ۚ inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlih ۖ wahuwa a`lamu bil muhtadīn

rows.arabic: وَإِنْ عَاقَبْتُمْ فَعَاقِبُوا۟ بِمِثْلِ مَا عُوقِبْتُم بِهِۦ ۖ وَلَئِن صَبَرْتُمْ لَهُوَ خَيْرٌ لِّلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: Should you retaliate, retaliate with the like of what you have been made to suffer, but if you are patient that is surely better for the steadfast.
rows.transliteration: wa in `āqabtum fa`āqibū bimithli mā `ūqibtum bih ۖ wala-in ṣabartum lahuwa khayrul lilṣṣābirīn

rows.arabic: وَٱصْبِرْ وَمَا صَبْرُكَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُ فِى ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: So be steadfast, and you cannot be steadfast except with Allah [’s help]. And do not grieve for them, nor be upset by their guile.
rows.transliteration: waṣbir wa mā ṣabruka illā billāh ۚ walā taḥzan `alayhim walā taku fī ḍayqin mimmā yamkurūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوا۟ وَّٱلَّذِينَ هُم مُّحْسِنُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed Allah is with those who are Godwary and those who are virtuous.
rows.transliteration: innallāha ma`al ladhīnat-taqaw wal ladhīna hum muḥsinūn
